page.title: 10Houses in Ryde
page.content: In{Ryde}most of the{roads are {straight}and the houses are mostly {Victorian houses.}My house is one hundred and thirty nine years old.There are many kinds of houses in Ryde and many of the Victorian houses are built of{yellow brick.}Builders today use{red bricks}because they are cheaper. When builders start a house ,they dig{deep foundations}especially as Ryde has a{clay soil.}Builders use bricks, cement, timber, tiles and glass to build a house.Tarred felt is used to damproof and on the roof. In Ryde the large Victorian houses are nearly all{converted into flats or {hotels. The{majority of homes are privately {owned}but there are council estates which are mostly rented.
